meanings.definition: Sharp or penetrating in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: The keen wind cut through my jacket.
meanings.sent2: She has a keen interest in learning new things.
meanings.sent3: The keen cat spotted the mouse from afar.
meanings.sent4: His keen eyes noticed every detail in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The keen smell of fresh bread filled the room.

meanings.sent1: I am keen to start my new job.
meanings.sent2: The children were keen to explore the new playground.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was keen to play fetch with the ball.
meanings.sent4: Her keen anticipation for the concert was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The students were keen to participate in the science experiment.

meanings.definition: Having a sharp edge or point.
meanings.sent1: The keen knife sliced through the bread effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: Be careful with that keen blade; it's very sharp.
meanings.sent3: The keen pencil drew precise lines on the paper.
meanings.sent4: The keen thorn pricked my finger as I reached for the rose.
meanings.sent5: The keen scissors neatly trimmed the edges of the paper.

meanings.sent1: She felt a keen sense of loss after her pet passed away.
meanings.sent2: The team had a keen determination to win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The keen flavor of the chili made my eyes water.
meanings.sent4: His keen desire for success drove him to work hard.
meanings.sent5: The keen pain in his leg made it difficult to walk.
